TopicTitle: How do you create realistic looking cars?

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I have been making cars for sometime now, but they never seem to look perfect or sometimes good. Even my best replica (an AC Cobra) pales in comparison to some cars that others have made. I wanted to ask everyone (who are all probably better than me by a long shot) for any advice and help on how to make the bodywork look better. Most of cars look somewhat boxy. Also, how do you add such fine details with parts like wings, such as very precise offsets and rotations of parts onto your cars. This is because when I try to make the front of the car, I always make it look more like a psychotic duck than a sports car.

Thank you

22 minutes ago, Kernel Kraken said:

Tweakscale and part mods.

I already have those mods. I use Airplane plus for more wing structures. I wanted to know some building techniques and advice for doing so.

But thanks anyways.

39 minutes ago, HyperDraco said:

... I wanted to know some building techniques and advice for doing so.

 

How about downloading a craft that you like and taking it apart to see how it was made? That's how I learned how to build unconventional craft when I first started.

1 hour ago, Dafni said:

How about downloading a craft that you like and taking it apart to see how it was made? That's how I learned how to build unconventional craft when I first started.

I have tried that before multiple times but I don't understand how they get it to look realistic. But I certainly did learn how to make my cars more powerful and stable. 

Thanks for the advice anyway
